pros: For the most part, people are nice. Pay is decent considering the area.
cons: Lack of support sometimes. High turnover rate.

pros: A Job that played its purpose
cons: Small department Department was in shambles at the time but could have gotten better

pros: New grad wants to start at ICU or ED
Great coworkers, good nurse to patient ratios
cons: Low pay compared to other hospitals, not enough working computers for nurses

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Gardena, CA
pros: Coworkers are nice and team players

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Experience especially as a stepping stool for something bigger
cons: They don’t appreciate nurses or any staff

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Gardena, CA
pros: You can easily gain experience working here and even transition to either Tele or ICU much easier than most hospitals.
cons: Poor staffing (almost always no CNA), the patient population is quite frustrating.

pros: Great people that care about their patient's but are being overworked.
cons: Turn around for employees including administration is very high

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Gardena, CA
cons: Terrible pay and schedule for everyone

pros: you get the days off you ask for
cons: Pharmacy staff is overworked and underappreciated

review_title: At this Hospital, I learned and used Terminal Digit Medical Fileing
pros: Working in the Records Department, you're alone, but occasionally encounter a fellow clerk and chat about how many records there are in the room, and which color code to look for. You can't talk for long, but It is interesting to see some of the illness descriptions and patients that have some strange hospital stays.
cons: I noticed long hours and overtime is a +. If I had a good day I could last, some days I needed to leave early.

pros:
- Workers are extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and proficient with their time.
- Everyone is always ready to provide their wisdom into the work they provide.
- Small hospital
cons:
- Patient demographic isn't ideal. Sometimes they may be combative
- Hospital seems a little run down, but you don't notice from the positive angry the employees provide.

pros: It used to be nice where you were like a family but when it was bought by the Avanti group it all changed for the worse.
cons: Very low pay, not competitive. Terrible benefit package. Demoralizing from the top down starting with the COO. Poor service. If you were sick, this is the last place you want to receive care.

job_title: Registered Nurse, PACU in Gardena, CA
pros: The hospital and the owners always seemed like they were really trying to improve things and make the employees happy.
cons: The manager I had was very difficult to work for.

pros: Small department great coop with other departments
cons: Not many benefited positions and changing staff with students
